summary: The Vienna Declaration was a statement to reinforce the Universal Declaration of Human Rights and the United Nations Charter.
full_text: The Vienna Declaration and Programme of Action, also known as VDPA, is a human rights declaration adopted by consensus at the World Conference on Human Rights on 25 June 1993 in Vienna, Austria. The United Nations High Commissioner for Human Rights was created by this Declaration endorsed by General Assembly Resolution 48/121.
title: Vienna Declaration
